channel.title: jira.namics.com
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4398] IF-11 OpenOrderCalculation - impossible to change the open order details
item.description:
With the IF-11 Open Order Calculation we need to change the following open order details:

  • Closing Date
  • Editable By All Accounts

At the moment this is not possible because the web service has the NewOrderEntries as mandatory element.

This means that we're not able only to modify the details without adding new items.

Could you please modify the webservice to consider NewOrderEntries as NON mandatory?
item.summary: IF-11 OpenOrderCalculation - impossible to change the open order details

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: In DISTRELEC-4398_openOrderCalculationError.xml you can find a sample request we would like to use to change the open order details.

Hello Maciej,
Could you please check? I have processed the request in SAP side and is working.
It works on SAP, because validation is done on PI side. I need to update schema. This is small fix - unfortunately I have some problems with environment access and it takes more than expected..
Question - what about response?
What do you mean?

I have changed mandatory to optional for 'newOrderEntries' in OpenOrderCalculationRequest.
The same field exist in OpenOrderCalculationResponse and is mandatory. Should it stay?

Hi Maciej
we have the same issue on the New SAP.

i've tried to execute this call:

<soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
	<soap:Body>
		<ns2:OpenOrderCalculationRequest xmlns:ns2="http://www.distrelec.com/hybris">
			<salesOrganization>7350</salesOrganization>
			<orderId>1000005564</orderId>
			<simulateOrder>false</simulateOrder>
			<contactId>0000337726</contactId>
			<shippingAddressId>0000768681</shippingAddressId>
			<customerReferenceHeaderLevel>WEBSHOP ORDER</customerReferenceHeaderLevel>
			<orderCloseDate>20140927</orderCloseDate>
			<editableByAllContacts>false</editableByAllContacts>
		</ns2:OpenOrderCalculationRequest>
	</soap:Body>
</soap:Envelope>

We get the following error:

com.sap.engine.interfaces.messaging.api.exception.MessagingException: com.sap.engine.interfaces.messaging.api.exception.MessagingException: Error encountered while executing mapping: com.sap.aii.af.service.mapping.MappingException: Mapping failed in runtimeRuntime Excep
tion when executing application mapping program com/sap/xi/tf/MM_IF11_OpenOrderCalculation_to_IF11_OpenOrderCalculation_Response; Details: com.sap.aii.mappingtool.tf7.IllegalInstanceException; Cannot create target element /ns1:OpenOrderCalculationResponse/newOrderEntr
ies. Values missing in queue context. Target XSD requires a value for this element, but the target-field mapping does not create one. Check whether the XML instance is valid for the source XSD, and whether the target-field mapping fulfils the requirement of the target X
SD

Could you please set the node newOrderEntries as optional?

Hello Maciej,
Could you please check from your side. It is working from the SAP side

Request has been fixed for both, Elfa and NewSAP. I asked earlier here if 'newOrderEntries' is optional in the response, but haven't got answer.
According to specification, 'newOrderEntries' is mandatory in the response. The error you get above concerns response.
Please answer my question regarding response and update specification if needed. Thanks!

Hi Maciej
yes, you're right.
I've changed the specification of the response of IF-11 OpenOrderCalculation and now the newOrderEntires and confirmedOrderEntries are now marked as optional

Could you please implement the change as well in PI?

Thank you in advance
Best Regards
Francesco
Changes transported to Q. Please test and let me know if everything works, thanks!

Hi Maciej
I've updated the WSDL and with this request:

<soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">

        <ns2:OpenOrderCalculationRequest xmlns:ns2="http://www.distrelec.com/hybris">
            <salesOrganization>7350</salesOrganization>

            <editableByAllContacts>false</editableByAllContacts>

should I transport this to P?

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5238] Register Existing - missing warning
item.description:
Issue
If no customer-ID has been entered, no warning is displayed below the form-field.

Requirement
If nothing is entered or the validation fails:

  • DE: Geben Sie Ihre Kundennummer ein
  • EN: Please enter your customer number

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Hello Raphael,
the FE work is done, but apparently the BE does not flag this field as mandatory and I'm not getting the error message.
Could you please have a look?
Thanks!

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5234] DE // Visability & filtering of invoice/orders
item.description:
As discussed please implement the following logic

If the customer is admin AND and least one subuser exists OR the DistSalesOrg.orderVisibleToAll/DistSalesOrg.invoiceVisibleToAll is true THEN please show a contact name filter dropdown.

ELSE

We should not show the contact name filter.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5216] Product info output per URL parameter
item.description:
We want to add a special URL to the EDI interfaces where the customer can read out the following product information:

  • Item Number (ERP Specific --> 6,7,8 digit)
  • Stock
  • Delivery time

They should be able to add the item number as parameter to this URL
For example:
http://www.distrelec.de/productinfo?[itemnumber]
item.summary: Product info output per URL parameter

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5036] Disable address selection in checkout for existing open order
item.description:
When the customer checkout with an existing open order the address selection part must be displayed in read-only.
Then all the radio buttons should be disabled. (see screenshoot)

Additionally, when the selection of the existing open order is done, the checkout address page should be reloaded to display the existing open order billing and shipping addresses selected.
item.summary: Disable address selection in checkout for existing open order

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
It seems that is not possible to display the currently selected addresses that comes from the Open Order since the addresses are duplicated in SAP, and they are different from the addresses related to the customer.
This beavior is correct because when an open order is created in sap, the addresses that belongs to him must be a copy of the original address.

So its not possible to display the selected shipping and billing addresses.

The solution is to completely hide the address table in checkoutaddress page in case of existing open order is selected.

After the merge the issue is back.
The addresses are not hidden when the existing open order checkout is choosed.
Can't reproduce the issue locally

Please test after the next deployment
Thanks

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5005] Text translation is not correct.
item.description:
Change
The message should say: "Die hochgeladene Datei entspricht nicht dem vorgegebenen Template. Dieses können Sie weiter unten herunterladen."

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4772] Clearance-project -> Required Webtrekk-implementation
item.description:
Hi Florian

As pre-discussed you are finding attached the Spec regarding the required Webtrekk-implementations for the Clearance-project. Please note that these implementations are among others depending on completion of DISTRELEC-3218.

Before starting with the implementation I suggest that the Spec shall be shortly pre-discussed with the assigned programming ressources.

Thanks! Mark

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Please discuss it on next Monday in the tracking task clarification meeting with Rubén and Dominic.
Try to clarify it and assign it back to me thx.
Thx.

Hi Florian

As mentioned I have roughly pre-discussed that with Ruben. Everything required is documented in this ticket (attachment). For the foreseen Go-Live of the Clearance-project (CW 35) I would need to know exactly which scope of the specified Webtrekk-requirements is feasible.

Thx Mark
Please add this ticket as subtask of the clearance-project implementation. Thx Mark
Please estimate.

Hello Mark,
Could you please test after the next deployment?
This ticket is in line with DISTRELEC-3218
Thanks
